title: Department of Physico-Chemical Problems of Metallurgical Processes

firstPersonCard.name: Stepanenko Dmytro Oleksandrovych
firstPersonCard.researchDirection: Analytical and experimental studies of the properties (viscosity, electrical conductivity, melting temperatures, etc.), mineralogical and phase composition of metallurgical slags and their physico-chemical interaction with metallic melts and refractories. Study of the structure of oxide and slag melts. Justification and development of technological indicators of the slag regime in the production of pig iron and steel.
firstPersonCard.specialization: 05.16.02 – Metallurgy of ferrous, non-ferrous metals and special alloys.

items: Development of the theory of physico-chemical modeling of multicomponent metallic and oxide systems, physico-chemical models of the structure of metallic and slag melts, study of the patterns of formation of their properties depending on the composition based on the parameters of interatomic interaction in them.

Study of the patterns of changes in the properties of metal products depending on the chemical composition and technology, which includes production, refining, modification and microalloying; description from unified methodological positions of the influence of the composition and conditions of production of metal products at different stages of processing on its quality; development of ways to optimize end-to-end production technologies and quality management of metal products.

Creation of an information support system for theoretical and applied metallurgy, including the creation, replenishment and updating of databases and data banks on the properties of charge materials, metallurgical melts and the results of their interaction based on the development of ideas from the theory of physico-chemical modeling.
Development of a methodology for creating models to predict the physico-chemical and technological properties of metallurgical melts based on the accumulated fund of experimental data.
Development of algorithmic and applied software for computer systems for the analysis of multidimensional arrays of experimental data in the information support systems of ASRD and ACS TP.
Development of computer systems for monitoring and managing the quality of pig iron and steel based on a comprehensive consideration of the physico-chemical and technological properties of melts.
